instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
small water damage near ssd rail.
pp3v3_g3h_rtc was short, i was fix it.
no other short.
PPBUS_G3H 12.2V
LDO reading o.k.
L9080/20/30 O.k.
no detected DFU.

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
What did you find bad on 3V3_G3H_RTC?
Check AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages.

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
C9500 (P3V3_G3H_SSD0_SNS)
NO AWAKE and  SLPS2R voltages!

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
Check U7800 LDOs.
Be sure R7900 is good.

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
U7800 LDOs - 
PMU_LDO3_OUT_R -564 0V
LDO_RTC - 360 0V

R7900 O.K

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
Do you get 3.3V at pin 2/R7900?
If yes, then bad PMU, or broken trace/solder.

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 89572, member: 682"]
Do you get 3.3V at pin 2/R7900?
[/QUOTE]
no its 0v

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
So, do you still think R7900 is good?
You've said to have 3.3V at pin 1:
"pp3v3_g3h_rtc was short, [B][U]i was fix it[/U][/B]"
Did you check R6934/35?

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
i was fixed the short but didnt get the 3V
replace R7900?

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
"Did you check R6934/35?"
Shorted C9500, supposedly burnt them...

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message: they are o.k i was replaced them.

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
So 3V3_G3H_RTC wasn't fixed; be more clear next time, on the mentions.

Does U6960 get VIN and EN?
Check R6970/1/2/6 and their traces.

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message:
PPVIN 12.2V
CHGR_EN_MVR_R-5V
R6970/1/2/6 are o.k with 0v

threads.title: 820-01700 5A 0A water damage.
threads.message: If all traces and surrounding components are good, then change U6960.
